data.formatted_address: 1-1 Honmaru, Naka Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 460-0031, Japan
data.name: Nagoya Castle

reviews.text: A nice castle but slightly smaller than other castles. It was a great experience to be able to walk through a section of the castle (not the main castle) where the rooms were re-enacted with the Hinoki wood. Explanations/contents were available in English and clearly written. Overall, a wonderful experience for young and old. The surrounding park offers a nice stroll too.

Japan is fantastic for low cost educational children's activities. Nagoya castle and palace is another great example of that.

Sadly the original palace burnt down during WWII, however the replica was constructed and is stunning. Beautiful grounds and gardens and bucketloads of history.

Ninjas and samurai roam the grounds too.

Lots of food options outside the castle grounds.

Well worth a visit even if briefly.
A bit smaller than other castles I've been to in Japan, but still worth a visit. Was quite a long wait to get inside on a hot summer day, so keep that in mind, but otherwise was a great experience.

When visiting Japan one must visit Nagoya, more specifically Nagoya Castle. The entrance fee is 500 Yen which you can pay by cash or credit care.

The castle is an architectural masterpiece. It really shows that the Japanese people have a true sense of detail and discipline.

The staff at this location is super friendly.  There are concessions stands inside the walls and the food is amazingly good and super cheap!

Due to earthquake damage the castle is currently closed to the public however the site can be visited.

There are many different castles, but the mint green of Nagoya Castle was a wonderful color.
I heard that cherry blossoms are in full bloom depending on the season (March~April).There is a parking lot nearby, and there is space for two-wheeled vehicles.Street plays and other events can be seen on the central street.
There are food stalls where you can have a light meal.

data.formatted_address: 1 Chome-36 Nagono, Nishi Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 451-0042, Japan
data.name: Shike-michi Townscape Preservation District

reviews.text: A street with a historical significance on how buildings were to be built to prevent the spread of fire. It is just an empty street with old locked-up buildings along it. There is nothing to do here or see. The only eye-candy is a futuristic looking BMW i8 parked along the street.
Historic buildings lined the street, but it is only a few blocks long. Snap a few photos and walk to the nearby shopping district.
A couple of nice historic streets. Most businesses were closed during the day - think it might be a night place .
I wish human bodies can be preserved to the same quality.
It was interesting learning about early Nagoya and how things got started. The area has various shops serving various foods.

data.formatted_address: 1-chōme-3 Shirakabe, Higashi Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 461-0011, Japan
data.name: Nagoya City Archives and Museum

reviews.text:
It was a good place, however not perfect.
Honestly 99.9% of the information is NOT English. You can watch photos, books, things but without understating a single word.
From 3 floors, only 1 was used. The other two were inactive.
The place was quite cozy, so was a good experience, but has a lot to improve.
Beautiful building and the displays about the old courtrooms and old Nagoya photos were more interesting than I would have expected. Free to visit and there are benches outside to relax.

It’s my first time to visit this place. If you are a type of person that likes History, architecture, and archives. This place is for you. Entrance is fee, pictorial is free also. When I visited this place, a newly wed couple picked this place for their pictorials.

A beautiful building and nice place to visit but as many people have said and have left reviews about, there is little effort to have any English (the language of travel) or other languages for foreign visitors but that is pretty typical in Japan. Where as an exhibit will have a full description in Japanese it may just be labeled ‘armor’ in English.
Very beautiful building and well maintained.

data.formatted_address: 1-1 Honmaru, Naka Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 460-0031, Japan
data.name: Honmaru Palace

reviews.text:
I have been here few times in few years, if you just visiting Nagoya, go first to Honmaru Castle. Restored wooden palace is such an amazing place to visit, such a great experience. I think it is really an architectural marvel.
The whole castle complex is worth visiting, go there in the morning preferably on a weekday, there is seasonal exhibitions take place. Like in the Autumn, different exhibitions for flowers, or Bonsai trees, etc. Walk around and enjoy this great place. There is place to rest if it's too hot outside and some nice little cafe and restaurants around the castle.

An interesting insight to how the palace used to look like and restored by amazing craftsmen down to every tiny detail.
It was a peaceful calm slowly observing each room as visitors were politely following the walkways and being respectful of their surroundings.
They offer audio guides in various languages for a small fee (iirc ¥100) and lockers for shoes and larger bags.

Free to enter after you paid for castle grounds and worth a quick visit. Apart from a few chests and decorated rooms there is also an interesting layout to see but nothing more. Moreover remember this is a restoration not an original piece, though still a nice one.
You will need to pay for admission to Nagoya castle to come here. Inside is extremely beautiful. The golden walls were stunning. Many rooms to enjoy. Definitely go if you’re in Nagoya!
Beautiful Japanese architecture and palace grounds, steeped in history.  Good food and snacks, and a lovely way to spend a few hours in Nagoya

data.formatted_address: 3-chōme-5-14先 Marunouchi, Naka Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 460-0002, Japan
data.name: ＠Nagoya Monument

reviews.text: Nice spot to take a photo

I walked through the park from Sotobori-dori to Hirokoji-dori, and the autumn leaves in Nagoya Sakae are beautiful. There are a lot of shops opening and it's revitalizing the area.
The young cherry trees are so cute. Photographed on March 21, 2024
As the trees along the road turn from yellow to red, it's getting colder.
The background of the monument is bad, but if you're coming to Nagoya this year, you might as well take a photo here...

It's a very good atmosphere.
Please find it!

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒455-0033 Aichi, Nagoya, Minato Ward, Minatomachi, 1−９ 名古屋港ポートビル 2F
data.name: Nagoya Port Building

reviews.text:
Outside, this place doesn't look like it has much.
Inside, there is a full Museum and observation deck.
Very clean place and friendly staff.
Huge waiting area wit a lot of chairs.
Great views!

But there is no Mitan and Portan stamps!

The service from the staff was really nice and friendly. The place is clean and comfortable. You may see the scenery of the sea, the port area, even to the city area. The Maritime museum also have detailed information for the diorama so it's easy to understand by foreign people.

The view was fantastic and there's a place where you can wear a seaman uniform and pretend you're driving a ship. There are a lot of 3D activities to try as well, like driving a ship and lifting containers in a port.
Great sunset view.
A good place to view the port of Nagoya from height.

data.formatted_address: 1-chōme-2-2 Sannomaru, Naka Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 460-0001, Japan
data.name: Kinshachi Yokocho

reviews.text:
This place is near Nagoya Castle.
Entrance is free. There are rows of shops sell food, souvenir and restaurants.
Not much more to do than what you see in the photos. There is one souvenir shop with items from local artists, a few restaurants and a couple liquor stores
A district near the Nagoya castle with many souvenir store and restaurant. Worth a visit for a lunch break if you are going to the Nagoya castle . Beware it a bit crowded during lunch time.
Went on a Typhoon day so there was barely any one there. Quite some restaurants there and it seems a place with nice old-Japan atmosphere. The entire place might be smaller than what you think it is.
Quiet and beautiful place to walk and eat in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Nagoya city.

data.formatted_address: 47 Miharashichō, Minami Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 457-0026, Japan
data.name: Nagoya City Miharashidai Archeological Museum

reviews.text: Amazing! Created lot important feeling and ideas.

The archaeological museum, which was built after excavations on this hill where it flourished during the Yayoi period, exhibits excavated earthenware and stone tools, allowing you to immerse yourself in the romance of history.
This hill was also used as an anti-aircraft gun base during the Pacific War, and approximately one-third of the archaeological museum exhibits artifacts related to the war. There are two gun emplacements left in the plaza outside, and you can imagine the sad scenes of war with your own eyes.
There is a parking lot for about 21 cars, admission is free, and there is also a plum garden and a plaza, perfect for a light picnic, and a great place for families up to elementary school age to spend time together.
The view of Kasadera Kannon from the hill is peaceful and wonderful.
It might be a good idea to visit at sunset, but the museum closes at 5 p.m., so the parking lot will probably be closed as well.

In April 2024, I stopped by on my way to Chukyo Racecourse by bicycle. Ruins from the Jomon and Yayoi periods have been found, and anti-aircraft equipment and military barracks were reportedly built there during World War II. At the museum, you can see pottery with round windows, and the manga character ``Marudon'' is unique and cute.
O Museu Arqueológico de Miharudai da cidade de Nagoya é uma instalação que coleta, pesquisa e exibe materiais relacionados às Ruínas de Miharudai.A entrada é gratuita.

Museum built on ruins
I went for the first time in early August 2023.
The museum, which opened in 1979, is located on top of the observation deck ruins in Kasadera Park and can be viewed for free.
The inside of the building has a Showa-era feel, but it is kept clean.
The permanent exhibition introduces earthenware and stone tools unearthed during excavations at the Miharodai ruins. There are also exhibits related to anti-aircraft gun positions during the Pacific War.
In the attached dwelling ruin observation building, the excavated pit dwelling ruins are recreated in full-size replicas, and the dwellings have been restored.
There are Kasadera Kannon and Kasadera Ichirizuka nearby, so if you are a history buff, we recommend going there as a set.

data.formatted_address: 1-５１ Nishikurachō, Minato Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 455-0034, Japan
data.name: Nagoya Port Sea Train Land

reviews.text: A small amusement park near the bay close to the Nagoya aquarium. Worth spending time here as it gave a local vibe and the view from the ferris wheel is very beautiful😇

Nagoya Port Sea Train Land is a beautiful, family-friendly attraction that our kids thoroughly enjoyed. The atmosphere was lively and welcoming, with many fun activities and amenities to entertain little ones. 😘😘

You can spend time here with good activities
Aquarium is also there
Small but heartwarming and nostalgic amusement park next to Nagoya port. Nice and friendly staff. Easy to access just 5 minutes walk from subway. Good for couple and family.

It is an amazing park for the kids and as well as adults. This is situated nesr Nagoya port dolphin park. There is no entry fee needed. There are some traditional rides are kept. Merry go round. Horse racing rides etc. If any ine wants to ride on every rides for meny time as they want can buy a norihoudai ticket. Norihoudai is a japanese word that means you can ride meny times as you want to ride. Like as buffet. :p eat as you like. On that case 2500 yen needed for this ticket. This price is for student those who are carrying student id card. Merry go round ride is as usual awesome. It is amazing port view from the merry go round car. Merry go round entry fee is 700 yen.  Nagoya port dolphin park also can be seen from this ride.  Other rides are also awesome. Anyone can spend their holidays with Nagoya port park and as well as this sea train land park in a day

data.formatted_address: LEGOLAND Japan Limited, 1 Kinjoufutou, 2-chōme-2 Kinjōfutō, Minato Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 455-8605, Japan
data.name: Legoland Japan Resort

reviews.text:
Not just for kids! Our family with teenagers had an awesome time at Legoland Nagoya in April 2024.
The rainy day kept the weekend crowds away, so we had literally no wait time for most rides. We rode The Dragon roller-coaster twice consecutively with no wait time.
The longest we waited was ~5 minutes for the Submarine ride, but it was well worth it!
As the rain got heavier, some rides were closed, but we were lucky enough to do the main ones before the rain got too much.

All in, we spent about 6 hours there, and I wish I could have spent more time looking at the Mini world. Stunning!

Things to note:
- Food is plentiful but very expensive inside and you cannot bring your own.
- The Lego box prices in The Big Store are not any cheaper than what you can buy in normal retail at home (Australia for me).
- The Big Store can hold your luggage for a fee (Y10,000) if they are too large to fit in a locker.
- Taxi service is available from the Lego Hotel, just outside the gates.

I had a blast here! I was not expecting to have as much fun as I did, me and my 20s year old friends booked the tickets and didn’t have high expectations, but we were surprised on how many cool attractions are there. Not only kids and family, but also adults can have a lot of fun, several attractions. My favorites are the water ones which provided a great refreshment to the warm weather. I had fun as I was a kid again!

The only improvement point I would say it’s the food court, we tried the Lego sandwich and it was below average and a bit pricey.

Overall, totally worth the visit!!

The greatest amusement theme park for little children. Kindergarten children will very enjoy. My daughter loved here more than Disney Land. She could play almost every rides.

No super famous mascots like other World class theme park, but can feel in with every Lego mascots here. I arrived here before open time.At the entrance had some attractions these you could enjoy them.

Admission ticket fees were much cheaper than Disney Land and Universal Studio. I bought entrance tickets online, cheaper and more convenient.

Easy to transportation. Subway and walk about 10-15 minutes. Children with stroller was easy to walk with elevators.

Most of guests here were family trip with little children. Lego small town was very impressive than I thought. They had atrractive and interesting movements.

Food courts was great value, reasonable prices, nice taste and not too crowd. Refill beverages made feel like stay in oasis. Everyone could enjoy tasty foods and refreshments.

Highly recommend for full one day with family trip. Little children would impressed and very enjoy here.

I'm so happy to bring the kids to Legoland!!! It was easy to get to Legoland. (We went on a weekday, Thursday.) The train was not cramped and we were able to get seats from Nagoya station. Given that there were about 10 stops, the family was able to sit comfortably.

The park felt empty compared to other theme parks like Disney and Universal Studios but it was perfect for me especially when your kids are below 10. The rides are perfect for kids their age. Not too boring, not too scary. I have 2 boys with me, aged 7 and 11. They enjoyed that there was no queue and they can repeat rides. It's like VVIP skip pass! We were able to try out all the rides!!!

Food is also reasonably priced. We tried the burger place.

Personal favorite rides: surfer, dragon roller coaster, ninja go ride and submarine!!! The submarine was an awesome experience.

Too much to see and explore in one day! We had so much fun, kids and grown ups too! Don’t miss the Ninjago live show (3-4 times daily - check showtime in website or ask the staff there) . For restaurant, recommend going to the traditional japanese one (on the right side of park next to the Ninjago live show theatre) - drinks is all-you-can-drink style.

data.formatted_address: Bunneyama-1-1 Ōdakachō, Midori Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 459-8001, Japan
data.name: Dino Adventure Nagoya

reviews.text:
Young adult minded little kids, baby stroller will be good to, on season blossoms with Cherry,..
We went on raining day still enjoyed walking only toy models of Dinosaurs

Open on golden week Monday. Also open all golden week
Fun for kids. Very expensive for adults. Recommend only one adult going with a few kids for best value for money. Currently ¥800 for one adult and ¥600 per child
If you have a family of 4 it can be very expensive
Max age likely 6yo or so. The move and make some noise for not only exciting normally finished in about 15 mins or so
Found this place by accident, super fun attraction and very cheap. Its just walking around looking at dino animatronics and hearing their sounds, but it was super cool.

My son is crazy about dinosaurs and I brought him there to show him life sized dinosaurs. I must say the entrance fee is a little steep but altogether there were 21 dinosaurs on display, the grandest being the Triceratops and T-Rex. All in all its worth the trip especially seeing the little tyke's expression.
That being said, pls take note there is no public transport heading in so it's a pretty long trek by foot from the nearest station, especially when visiting in winter. Winds are also very strong so pls wear adequately to stay warm. The park also have alot of up and down slopes so I would not recommend for older folks on wheelchair to visit either. But the upside is there isn't much of a crowd so we kinda had the whole place to ourselves haha.
I won't post all the pictures so that the park can stay relevant. JUST SO YOU KNOW, ALL THE DINOSAURS ACTUALLY MOVE so pls be close to your little ones to placate them. Fun and memorable trip.

The park is definitely for Smaller kids who love dinosaurs! My 4 year old was mesmerized and truly engaged walking among some of its  favorite animals. The park is well kept, you can definitely tell the animals are not new and would need a oil down, but or does the job!

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒460-0008 Aichi, Nagoya, Naka Ward, Sakae, 2-chōme−17−１ 芸術と科学の杜・白川公園内
data.name: Nagoya City Science Museum

reviews.text:
This is a really varied and dynamic museum, with lots of interactive exhibitions, informative signs to read and a really, really amazing planetarium. It can be quite busy on the day, so it's best to get tickets in advance lest you end up waiting in a very long line on a hot day!

The central location is very nice though, which makes it easy to get to. There's something here for everyone, whether you are a child, adult or a just interested in science in general!

The Nagoya City Science Museum (名古屋市科学館, Nagoya-shi Kagakukan) features a characteristic giant silver globe, which houses one of the world's largest planetariums. Programs at the planetarium vary monthly and cover current astronomical phenomena. Although shows are conducted only in Japanese, they can nevertheless be interesting just by looking at the stars and other elements of nature being projected on the huge spherical screen.

Five floors of the seven-storied museum are dedicated to a comprehensive array of permanent exhibits, while temporary exhibitions are periodically held in the basement. The permanent exhibits present ample opportunities for visitors of all ages to try their hand at learning science through interactive experiments. They include several large displays such as the "Tornado Lab", the "Electric Discharge Lab" and the "Deep Freezing Lab," which simulates conditions at the earth's polar regions.

It was first time to visit Nagoya with two children. They are 10 and 13 years old and enjoyed the place so much. We couldn’t get out of there even though we (I and my husband) became very tired.
We booked the tickets like special exhibition and planetarium a day before. When we got to the science museum, there was a long queue to buy tickets.
Highly recommend this place for whom with children!

The museum was so much fun to explore and they had really cool exhibits on every floor! Unfortunately the planetarium was closed when we went but I can imagine that would be awesome to see as well. I enjoyed the special exhibit they had going on, it did take us a minute to find it though as the stairs to the basement aren’t in the same place as the the main escalators we saw everyone taking. Definitely a kid friendly place and lots of things you can interact with.

It has 6 floors!! Filled to the brim with practical science areas where you can watch the theory be turned into practice. I loved the tornado simulation, it was stunning! There where a lot of school kids visiting though, from young to old children who made heaps of noise but where respectful of those around them.

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒466-0063 愛知県名古屋市昭和区山脇町１丁目３２
data.name: Hachiman-yama-kofun Tumulus, Nationally Designated Historic Site

reviews.text: It's a great spot to enjoy sakura blooming. For the other time it would be interesting to very small group of people who has particular interest in history or something related. Basically it just a hill with trees behind a small fance. You can't go there only look from outside

An old burial mound right next to Tsuruma park. No benches or anything just a small rode around it. But the best thing about it is that during cherry blossom season the mound is circled with cherry trees making a great photo location.

An ancient tomb located next to Tsurumai Park.
Unlike Tsurumai Park, it is not crowded, so this is recommended for pure cherry blossom viewing.
You can't go inside, so you'll have to walk around to see it. There are no food stalls, and it's near a residential area, so you can't have a party. If you prefer dango over flowers, you should go to Tsurumai Park next door.
Normally, it would be the best time to see the flowers even into April.
In 2023, it was in full bloom on March 26, and most of it had fallen when I visited.

It is said to be called Mt. Hachiman because the shrine of Hachiman Shrine was located at the top of the mountain.
Apparently the top of his head had been shaved off because an anti-aircraft gun was installed there during the war.
After the war, Nagoya City carried out mound shaping and tree planting, which continues to this day.
Although no official excavation has been carried out, hearsay has it that figural clay and morning glory-shaped cylindrical clay were unearthed, but they were lost due to war damage.
It is said to be one of the largest circular tombs in the Tokai region.

Diameter 82m. The largest circular tomb in the Tokai region. National historic site.
It was said to have been used as an anti-aircraft gun position during the war.
It looks like there are some fixes, but
Even so, the shape is beautiful.
A beautiful cone that looks 360 degrees from any angle.
360 degree uniform surrounding moat.
It may be the most graceful figure I have ever seen.

Apparently you can enter if you get permission in advance.
Basically, entry is prohibited.
Of course, conservation is important.
However, it was a good location next to Tsurumai Park.
Because it is well maintained,
Just try a little harder on the mountain trail.
I wonder if they could make a tour route or something.
The cherry blossoms are said to be beautiful in spring, so it's a great spot to see them.
I think it will be.

data.formatted_address: Nagoya Port, 1-3 Minatomachi, Minato Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 455-0033, Japan
data.name: ＠Nagoya Monument

It really happened! !
This is a series post.

There weren't too many people and I was able to take some nice photos after waiting a while.

The whole Nagoya port area was quite disappointing. Little life compared to the port of Kobe or Osaka, for example. At nightfall, in the middle of summer, very few restaurants are open. We couldn't visit anything because everything was closed. Poor night lighting. Maybe it's better during the day?

Aquarium🐟Take a picture before going
There are 4 monuments in Nagoya.
Please come around 🍀

data.formatted_address: 1-chōme-10-45 Hataya, Atsuta Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 456-0027, Japan
data.name: Danpusan Kofun

reviews.text: Not much to see, but still an impressively sized kofun.
Good chilling out spot.

It is a historic tomb. There is also an information sign. In the past, it was written that the general public could only climb the mountain on March 3rd, but today was just March 3rd, so I called the management office and climbed it. (I wonder if I can climb other than 3/3 now?)
Unlike in the past, there are trees and you can't see the scenery. Even after getting off the train, you have to call out to the management office to let them know that you have returned.

This tumulus seems to be the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus in the Tokai region.
The construction part was very easy to understand, but the mound was not.

This ancient tomb is said to be the tomb of the Owari clan and also the tomb of Miyazakihime. It is said to be the largest in the Tokai region, and it looked like a forest. You can enter the mountain if you apply at the management office on the north side.
